author: Gopi
title: Mamata not repentant for hurting Hindu sentiments by 'Mrityu Kumbh' remarks: Suvendu Adhikari
text:
Kolkata, Feb 20 (SocialNews.XYZ) Slamming Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, Leader of Opposition in West Bengal Assembly Suvendu Adhikari on Thursday said "the biggest tragedy is that the CM is not repentant of her move to hurt the Hindu sentiments by describing Maha Kumbh at Prayagraj in Uttar Pradesh as 'Mrityu Kumbh' in the House" earlier this week.
“If she had made the statement by mistake, then she could have withdrawn that and tendered an apology for that. But she had not done that even after 48 hours have passed since she made a statement on the floor of the House,” Adhikari told media persons on Thursday afternoon after a team of members of BJP's legislative team from the West Bengal Assembly met the Governor C.V. Ananda Bose submitted a memorandum seeking his intervention into the matter.
Apart from criticising the Chief Minister over the “Mrityu Kumbh” remarks, the BJP legislators also sought the Governor’s intervention on the recent suspension of four BJP legislators, including the leader of the opposition, from the house for a month.
Adhikari also claimed that during the interactions the Governor described Maha Kumbh as “Maha Mrityunjay Kumbh”.
“The Chief Minister described it ‘Mrityu Kumbh’. On the contrary, the Governor described the event as ‘Maha Mrityunjay Kumbh’. This reflects the faith of traditional Hindus. So our protests against the Chief Minister’s statements hurting the traditional Hindu sentiments will continue,” Suvendu Adhikari said.
“We have requested the Governor to personally intervene and ensure that the Chief Minister’s statement on ‘Mrityu Kumbh’ is expunged from the records of the state Assembly. We have requested the Governor to give directions to the Speaker of the House in the matter. We do not want such comments to be in the records of this great house in the future," Adhikari said.
Speaking on the occasion, he also said that the Chief Minister of late has become conscious of her Hindu identity and often makes claims about that identity.
“This is because she has become aware that a negative perspective among the Hindu population in West Bengal has developed a negative perspective about her and her party," Adhikari said.
Source: IANS
About
Gopi
Gopi Adusumilli is a Programmer. He is the editor of SocialNews.XYZ and President of AGK Fire Inc.
He enjoys designing websites, developing mobile applications and publishing news articles on current events from various authenticated news sources.
When it comes to writing he likes to write about current world politics and Indian Movies. His future plans include developing SocialNews.XYZ into a News website that has no bias or judgment towards any.
He can be reached at
gopi@socialnews.xyz

author: FABIÉ Denise
title: Denise FABIÉ - Avis d'obsèques et remerciements du 24/12/2023 - L'indépendant
text: Avis d'obsèques et remerciements de Madame Denise FABIÉ Festes-et-Saint-André (11) Première publication le 24 décembre 2023 4 consultations Avis d'obsèques et remerciements Festes-et-Saint-André. M. Bernard FABIÉ, son fils ; M. et Mme Guy et Malika FABIÉ, son fils ; M. Claude FABIÉ, son fils ; M. et Mme Joël et Ghislaine FABIÉ, son fils ; Mme et M. Valérie et Jérôme LACLAVERE, sa fille ; ses petits-enfants ; ses arrière-petits-enfants, parents et alliés ont la douleur de vous faire part du décès de Madame Denise FABIÉ née SAURÉ Les obsèques seront célébrées le mercredi 27 décembre 2023, à 15 heures , au cimetière de Festes-et-Saint-André. Denise repose au pavillon funéraire du Limouxin, impasse Didier Daurat, 11300 Limoux, où la famille recevra ce dimanche, lundi et mardi, de 15 heures à 17 heures. La famille remercie toutes les personnes qui par leur présence ou leurs marques de sympathie s'associeront à sa peine. POMPES FUNEBRES LIMOUXINES Tél. 04.68.31.63.04 / 06.74.20.48.39 Hommages et messages à Denise FABIÉ Aucun hommage ou message n'a été déposé à ce jour.

author: @LANACION
title: Los tres "colores" en la casa que pueden poner en riesgo tu salud - LA NACION
text:
Los hongos son parte de nuestras vidas . Están presentes en algunos quesos que comemos, en los medicamentos que utilizamos e incluso en nuestra piel. Junto con las bacterias, los virus, los ácaros y los protozoos, los hongos se encuentran entre los microorganismos que inhalamos a diario . Sin embargo, la exposición crónica a ciertos tipos , como los que forman moho, puede tener efectos negativos para la salud . Según un artículo publicado en el portal IFLScience, el moho es una estructura que pueden desarrollar algunos hongos . Generalmente tiene un aspecto oscuro y velloso y un olor fuerte, creciendo en ambientes con alta humedad . Para reproducirse, el moho libera esporas microscópicas que quedan suspendidas en el aire. Cuando entran en contacto con nuestro cuerpo , estas esporas pueden causar congestión nasal, sibilancia y picazón en los ojos .
CRÉDITOS HIPOTECARIOS: CUÁNTO TENÉS QUE GANAR PARA PEDIR UN PRÉSTAMO UVA Normalmente, cuando estamos sanos , nuestro sistema inmunológico es capaz de evitar que la exposición al moho produzca algún efecto desagradable . Sin embargo, para las personas con asma, problemas respiratorios, sistemas inmunes debilitados o alergias específicas, la exposición constante al hongo puede ser peligrosa . Por lo tanto, es importante controlar el exceso de humedad e identificar el tipo de moho presente.
A continuación te contamos lo que los diferentes colores del moho revelan sobre sus riesgos:
Moho negro El moho negro es una presencia común en hogares con problemas de humedad , pero diferentes especies pueden presentar esta coloración, variando en toxicidad. Uno de los más indeseables es el Stachybotrys , que tiene preferencia por materiales con alto contenido de celulosa. Esto hace que los tableros de fibra, los paneles de yeso y el papel sean lugares ideales para su crecimiento , siempre que haya humedad constante.
Si ha aparecido moho negro en su ducha, es probable que se trate de Aureobasidium . En altas concentraciones, puede causar hipersensibilidad , alergias y síntomas respiratorios. Una solución de cloro diluido puede ayudar a eliminarlo , pero la mancha puede persistir incluso después de eliminar el hongo.
QUÉ SIGNIFICA ENCONTRAR CUCARACHAS CON LAS PATAS HACIA ARRIBA
El moho negro es probable que se trate de Aureobasidium Shutterstock

author: @teletica
title: ¡De taller en taller! Descubra el mundo del paisajismo acuático
text:
¡De taller en taller! Descubra el mundo del paisajismo acuático
Esta técnica no solo mejora la estética, sino que también contribuye a la salud del ecosistema marino en el hogar.
En el taller de hoy, nos adentramos en el fascinante mundo de las peceras plantadas, de la mano del Acuario Paisajismo Plantado.
Con la guía de expertos, los participantes aprenden a diseñar acuarios con plantas acuáticas, una técnica que no solo mejora la estética, sino que también contribuye a la salud del ecosistema marino en el hogar (ver nota completa en el video adjunto).
Rodrigo Valerio, de Acuario Paisajismo Plantado, explica que las plantas acuáticas ayudan a controlar las algas no deseadas y crean un refugio natural para los peces.
“Las peceras plantadas no solo embellecen los espacios, sino que también proporcionan un equilibrio biológico en el acuario”, comenta Valerio.
Entre los asistentes al taller se encuentran Jorge White, Kimberly Fariña y Karina Rivera Fernández, quienes han decidido sumergirse en el arte del paisajismo acuático. Durante tres horas, reciben asesoría sobre la selección de plantas, sustratos y cuidados básicos para mantener un acuario saludable y armonioso.
Acuario Paisajismo Plantado no solo asesora a principiantes en el mundo de las peceras acuáticas, sino que también ofrece talleres especializados para quienes desean aprender más sobre este arte y su mantenimiento. Ubicados en Tres Ríos centro, 200 metros sur del cementerio, contiguo al Poder Judicial, atienden de martes a domingo.
Para más información, puede contactarlos al teléfono 7213-1613 o seguirlos en redes sociales y Waze como @AcuarioPaisajismoPlantadoCR.

author: world today news
title: Faced with the iPad, Google folds and cancels its next tablet
text:
Rumor has it today that Google is finally skipping this generation to go directly to the <a href="https://www.world-today-news.com/leaked-pixel-tablet-3-details-reveal-it-will-have-two-usb-c-ports-but-a-lower-tensor-g6-chip/" title="Leaked Pixel Tablet 3 details reveal it will have two USB-C ports but a lower Tensor G6 chip”>Pixel Tablet 3 . The site Android Headlines indicated at the same time that kiyomi was the name given internally to this Pixel Tablet 3, but Android Authority denies this information. The Pixel Tablet 3 is reportedly equipped with a Google Tensor G6 processor, and is not expected before 2027.
For our part, we remain doubtful about this information and we believe that if the Pixel Tablet 2 has been canceled, everything suggests that Google is simply abandoning the tablet market. The Pixel Tablet was not very successful, and the search engine did not seek, at least in France, to promote its product. Google also has a reputation for quickly putting an end to projects that do not meet their audience, like Google Stadia, which was disconnected in a few weeks.
The future of Android tablets would therefore be played out by other manufacturers, such as Samsung or Xiaomi who remain invested in the subject. It remains to be seen whether Google will still continue its efforts on the software side, by adapting more of its applications to the 10-inch format and above.
**If you were advising Google ⁢on⁤ their tablet strategy, what ‍key features ⁢or ⁣innovations⁣ would you ⁢recommend⁢ they focus on to differentiate ‍Pixel Tablets and compete effectively in ⁤a market dominated by ⁢Samsung and Apple?** ## The Future of​ Pixel Tablets: An Insightful Discussion
**Welcome ⁣to World Today News! Today we’re ⁤diving deep into the rumor mill surrounding⁢ Google’s Pixel Tablets. Joining us are two tech​ experts with contrasting ⁤perspectives: [Guest 1 Name],‍ a seasoned technology analyst known for ‌their⁢ insightful market predictions, and [Guest 2 Name], ⁢a passionate advocate⁢ for Google’s‌ innovative ventures.**
‍ **Theme 1: The Rumor Mill ⁢& Speculation**
* **Host:** [Guest 1 Name], let’s start ‍with you. The rumor about Google skipping a generation of⁢ Pixel Tablets ​and ⁣jumping ​straight to the Pixel Tablet 3 is ⁢quite ⁤intriguing. What are your initial thoughts on this ⁢speculation, ‌and ⁢what factors do you think ⁢might be⁤ driving it?
* **[Guest 1 Name]:**
* **Host:** [Guest 2 Name], ‌ you’re known for your ⁣optimism when it comes to Google’s tech advancements. Do you buy into this rumor,⁢ or ‌do you think it’s more⁣ likely Google ⁤will launch a⁣ Pixel Tablet 2 first?
*​ **[Guest 2 Name]:**
**Theme 2: Google’s Tablet ⁤History & Strategy**
*‌ **Host:** Let’s look at Google’s track record with tablets. The Pixel Tablet, despite⁤ its potential, didn’t quite make a splash in the‌ market. [Guest 1 Name], considering this, how do you see ‌this potential generation skip impacting ⁤Google’s ‌motivation‌ to stay in the tablet game?
*​ **[Guest 1 Name]:**
* **Host:** [Guest 2 Name], Google has ⁢a history of pivoting and ⁢refocusing its efforts. ​Do you believe that even‌ if​ the Pixel Tablet⁢ 2⁣ is canceled, Google might ⁣still find ⁤a different ⁤way to ​stay relevant in the⁢ Android tablet space, perhaps through software optimization or partnerships?
*⁢ **[Guest 2 Name]:**
**Theme 3: The Future of Android Tablets**
* **Host:** Looking ‌beyond Google, ‍we see strong contenders like Samsung and Xiaomi actively developing and improving their⁣ tablet offerings. [Guest 1 Name], how do you foresee the Android tablet⁤ market evolving in the coming ‌years, regardless of Google’s involvement?
*⁣ **[Guest 1 Name]:**
* **Host:** [Guest 2 Name], with the potential rise of ‌foldable devices and other innovations, do you ⁤think the traditional tablet form factor will remain ⁢relevant, or will we see a shift towards new and exciting paradigms?
* **[Guest 2 Name]:**
**Theme 4: Final Thoughts & Predictions**

* **[Guest 1 Name]:**

* **[Guest 2 Name]:**
**Closing Remarks**

We’ll be closely watching to see how ​this story⁢ unfolds. Stay tuned to World Today News for​ more⁢ updates⁣ on the ever-evolving world of technology!

author: Kendra MacDonald
title: Unlocking the power of the ocean: threading the economic needle on the path to net zero - The Hill Times
text: Canada and Norway are, unquestionably, ocean nations shaped by our respective seas and some of the world’s longest coastlines. We share a long-standing diplomatic relationship spanning more than 80 years, and both nations have a history which is deeply connected to ocean resources. For centuries, the ocean has been a part of the very fabric that shaped our industries, deeply connected to our communities, Indigenous Peoples, and workforces. It is part of who we are. And today, in a changing world, where energy transition, food security, and emissions reductions are at the top of the global agenda, Canada and Norway are once again looking to the ocean’s transformational potential to not only reshape our economies, but also protect the well-being of the planet. It is the challenge—and opportunity—of our time. And we are working together to meet the moment. Kendra MacDonald is the CEO of Canada’s Ocean Supercluster. Handout photograph Canada and Norway are amongst world leaders from 18 countries who form the High-Level Panel for a Sustainable Ocean Economy (Ocean Panel). A recent study commissioned by the Ocean Panel found that up to 35 per cent of the required emissions reductions by 2050 can be achieved through ocean-based action. As ocean nations—with long maritime histories, robust resources, and some of the most innovative people on the planet—there is significant economic opportunity in achieving these emissions reductions targets through the sustainable development of our ocean and the solutions it can provide. The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development predicts the global ocean economy will outpace the growth of the broader economy by 20 per cent, growing to $3-trillion by 2030. Trine Jøranli Eskedal is Norway's ambassador to Canada. Handout photograph Every day, hundreds of thousands of Norwegians and Canadians go to work in industries related or connected to the ocean, including fisheries that have long sustained communities and the people that live in them; aquaculture that is projected to help meet the world’s growing demand for sustainable protein; marine transport, where most of the world’s commerce is done; energy transition to renewables; ocean technology that enables increased sustainability and reduced environmental footprint, and newly emerging segments of the ocean sector. In Norway, the ocean sector accounts for about 70 per cent of the country’s export earnings, with a forward-looking potential for growth. Meanwhile, in Canada, ocean business contributes approximately 1.6 per cent of the national GDP—less than half of the world average. With a vision to do more, Canada’s Ocean Supercluster is uniting its ocean network around a recently launched industry-led ambition, called Ambition 2035, to grow Canada’s ocean economy by five times to $220-billion. Under this goal, Canada’s ocean economy would create tens of thousands of more jobs for Canadians, whether they live near or far from one of our three oceans. On April 11, Canada’s Ocean Supercluster and the Norwegian Embassy in Ottawa hosted leaders in industry, ocean technology, community, and the public sector to discuss the prioritization of the ocean sector. The event is an opportunity to foster collaboration between Canada and Norway and identify key areas where we can work together to deliver sustainable ocean solutions. From making the electrification of vessels more viable, to sustainable aquaculture and fishing, to hydrogen and energy solutions, Canada and Norway are at the forefront of solving some of the world’s biggest challenges, by leveraging advancing technologies such as autonomous vessels, sensors, digital twins, and artificial intelligence. Meanwhile, another major ocean event is being held this week as well in Barcelona: the 2024 UN Ocean Decade Conference, hosted by Spain and co-organized with UNESCO’s Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission. The meeting provides another global forum for countries to identify joint ocean-related actions around climate change, a sustainable ocean economy, and other major policy issues. If you don’t live by an ocean, you might not give it much thought. Most people probably don’t. While the significance of what lies beneath our ocean may be understated, its impact on every single one of us cannot be downplayed. From the air we breathe, the food we eat, the goods we move, the energy we use—and in our fight against climate change and building a robust future economy—our ocean is at the heart of it all. This is one of the most important opportunities of our time—a time to be bold and embrace our identity as ocean nations. This starts with creating a policy framework which enables us to actualize the game-changing opportunity the ocean holds, and to unravel the complexities around sustainability and economic growth. The health of our planet and our citizens depends on it. Kendra MacDonald is the CEO of Canada’s Ocean Supercluster, responsible for the accelerated development and commercialization of innovation that is solving some of the world’s biggest challenges in ocean. MacDonald is leading the change in the culture of doing business in ocean from coast-to-coast-to-coast, increasing collaboration across ocean sectors and growing Canada’s ocean economy in a digital, sustainable, and inclusive way. Her Excellency Trine Jøranli Eskedal is Norway's ambassador to Canada, and took up responsibilities in October 2023. Previously, Jøranli Eskedal served as ambassador to Sri Lanka and the Maldives from 2019-2023, and worked at the Norwegian Parliament (Storting) from 2016-2019 as head of section for Arctic, Nordic and European affairs in the International Department. The Hill Times

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Mary Trump Calls Maine's Decision to Remove Donald Trump From the Ballot 'a Huge Victory for Democracy'
text: Former President Donald Trump's niece Mary Trump has called Maine's recent decision to remove her uncle from the ballot "a huge victory for democracy." Amid the onslaught of legal battles surrounding Donald, Maine's Secretary of State, Shenna Bellows , removed him from the state's primary ballot. This decision came in light of her interpretation of the 14th Amendment to the Constitution, which prohibits individuals who have taken part in " insurrection or rebellion " from holding certain positions in office, such as the president of the United States. Bellows' ruling was reportedly made with careful consideration, as she emphasized the sacred nature of democracy . In a statement on her Substack blog, she said, "I do not reach this conclusion lightly. Democracy is sacred...I am mindful that no Secretary of State has ever deprived a presidential candidate of ballot access based on Section Three of the Fourteenth Amendment." Mary commented on the post, "H--- YEAH!" adding, "NO ONE should give Donald a free pass ... not according to Section 3 of the 14th amendment — the Equal Protection clause." She added: "This is what JUSTICE looks like. What happens now? Over a DOZEN states may do the same — kick Donald right off the ballot. Make no mistake: This is a HUGE Victory for democracy." Bellows' decision marks a new precedent in Maine's history. This move adds to the growing list of legal challenges faced by Trump, as similar lawsuits seeking to exclude him from 2024 primary ballots are pending in 14 states nationwide: Arizona, Alaska, Nevada, New Jersey , New Mexico, New York , Oregon, South Carolina , Texas, Vermont, Virginia, West Virginia, Wisconsin and Wyoming. Never miss a story — sign up for the OK! newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what OK! has to offer. It’s gossip too good to wait for! The decision to remove Donald from the Maine primary ballot has the potential to significantly impact the 2024 Republican presidential nomination process, as recent polling indicated Donald is the frontrunner for the nomination. The context behind these legal battles stems from the events that unfolded during the ex-POTUS' attempts to overturn the 2020 presidential election result. The father-of-five currently faces federal charges of breaking the law during this period. During this time, hundreds of his supporters stormed the Capitol on January 6 , 2021. Donald has pleaded not guilty to all charges, maintaining that the case against him is politically motivated.
